item.title: 8 dead, 778 hospitalised as Bangladesh fails to curb dengue
item.description: The dengue situation in Bangladesh continues to deteriorate as eight more deaths were reported from dengue in 24 hours till Sunday morning, raising the number of fatalities from the mosquito-borne disease in Bangladesh to 364 this year. During the same period, 778 new patients were admitted to hos

item.title: Gas price for fertiliser factories hiked by 83pc
item.description: Bangladesh has increased the price of gas supplied to fertiliser factories by 83 percent per cubic metre. In a statement on Sunday, the Bangladesh Energy Regulatory Commission (BERC) said that the price per cubic metre would rise from Tk 16 to Tk 29.25. The new rate will take effect on Dec 1. Th

item.title: ICC Bangladesh organizes workshop for SMEs, women entrepreneurs
item.description: International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) Bangladesh organized a day-long workshop on ‘Capacity building of MSMEs and Women Entrepreneurs’ for using ICC Rules in International Trade on Saturday in a city hotel, Chattogram. The workshop has been designed for the benefits of MSMEs and Wome

item.title: Bhutanese PM hails Kurigram SEZ as crucial G2G project
item.description: Bhutanese Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay on Sunday described the Kurigram Special Economic Zone (SEZ), which is currently being constructed under a Government-to-Government (G2G) partnership, as an important project. “This zone in Bangladesh would connect with Bhutan’s forthcoming spec

item.title: Well driiling and seismic survey in gas fields suspeneded
item.description: All types of drilling and seismic survey operations of state-run gas exploration companies have been suspended for 48 hours until 8 am on November 25 as a precautionary measure due to earthquake concerns. State-run Petrobangla announced on Sunday the suspension of exploration activities to ensure

item.title: Prof Yunus, Bhutan’s PM, pledges stronger collaboration across SAARC, BIMSTEC
item.description: Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus and visiting Bhutanese Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay have reaffirmed their commitment and cooperation at the international, regional and sub-regional platforms, like SAARC and BIMSTEC based on the principles of shared values, mutual respect, understanding, coopera

item.title: US to launch new phase of Venezuela operations, sources say
item.description: The United States is poised to launch a new phase of Venezuela-related operations in the coming days, four US officials told Reuters, as the Trump administration escalates pressure on President Nicolas Maduro's government. Reuters was not able to establish the exact timing or scope of the new oper

item.title: Khaleda to go to hospital for health check-up shortly
item.description: BNP Chairperson and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia will go to Evercare Hospital in the capital on Sunday evening for a health check-up. “Madam (Khaleda) will be taken to Evercare Hospital for a health check-up as advised by her medical board,” said BNP Media Cell member Sayrul Kabir

item.title: EBL partners with SSCL to launch advanced supply chain finance platform
item.description: Eastern Bank PLC. (EBL) has signed an agreement with Spectrum Software and Consulting (Pvt.) Ltd. (SSCL) to implement OptiFin, a flagship Supply Chain Finance solution by SSLC. Riad Mahmud Chowdhury, Deputy Managing Director and Head of Corporate Banking at EBL, and Mushfiqur Rahman, Managing Dire

item.title: Election candidates must disclose domestic, foreign assets: ACC chairman
item.description: Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) Chairman Dr Mohammad Abdul Momen on Sunday said contestants in the upcoming election must declare their foreign assets along with domestic ones while submitting election affidavits. He made the remarks after laying the foundation stone of the ACC’s Sylhet Div

item.title: DOGE 'doesn't exist' with eight months left on its charter
item.description: US President Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency has disbanded with eight months left to its mandate, ending an initiative launched with fanfare as a symbol of Trump's pledge to slash the government's size but which critics say delivered few measurable savings. "That doesn't exist,"

item.title: Bangladesh sends fresh letter to India seeking Hasina’s return
item.description: The interim government has sent another letter to India seeking the return of Sheikh Hasina, who was sentenced to death for crimes against humanity during the July Uprising.
